page.title: 01Coast North of Cushendun
page.content: On the edge of the Cushleake Mountains scarcely any farmsteads now remain on the steep exposed slopes that rise form the cliff edge.The greater part of this upland is coarse grassland, deteriorating to peat bog whenever the terrain levels off. Only a narrow ribbon of improved grazing for sheep or cattle clings to the minor road below Carnaneigh. In contrast to the cramped space of the small farmlands to the views away to the south beyond Cushendun are wide and spectacular and many summer tourists drive or climb the steep hill from the village merely to take in that panorama.
